title: Paramater type deduction fails to coerce fn item to function pointer if surrounded by Option.

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

labels.name: A-coercions
labels.description: Area: implicit and explicit `expr as Type` coercions

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
fn foo(_: Option<fn()>) {}
fn bar() {}

pub fn main() {
    foo(Some(bar)); // Works
    let f = Some(bar);
    foo(f) // error[E0308]: mismatched types expected fn pointer, found fn item
}
```

I expected to see this happen: 
IMHO this should compile. The fn item should coerce into the function ptr, even if surrounded by `Option`.

Instead, this happened:

```
  |
7 |     foo(f) // error[E0308]: mismatched types expected fn pointer, found fn item
  |         ^ expected fn pointer, found fn item
  |
  = note: expected enum `std::option::Option<fn()>`
             found enum `std::option::Option<fn() {bar}>`
```

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

rustc 1.43.0 (4fb7144ed 2020-04-20)
